What are the Most Common Issues with Rented Printers?

July 1, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Renting a printer is a smart solution for many businesses. It offers flexibility, saves upfront costs, and provides access to the latest printing technology without the burden of ownership. However, as with any service-based solution, printer rentals come with a few potential challenges. So, what are the most common issues with rented printers? Let’s dive into the key problems users might face—and how to solve or prevent them.

1. Printer Downtime or Frequent Malfunctions

One of the most common complaints with rented printers is equipment downtime. A printer may stop working entirely or experience recurring issues such as:

  • Paper jams

  • Poor print quality (faded or streaky prints)

  • Connectivity problems

  • Error messages with no clear cause

These issues often result from wear and tear or outdated units that haven’t been properly maintained.

Tip: Choose a rental provider that includes routine maintenance and quick repair services in the rental agreement. You can learn more about what’s usually included in a rental plan by visiting What Is Included in a Printer Rental Agreement?

2. Delayed Technical Support or Slow Response Time

When something goes wrong, getting help quickly is crucial. Unfortunately, some rental providers don’t offer fast or efficient technical support. This can lead to delays in resolving issues, interrupting business operations—especially for companies that rely heavily on printing.

What to look for:
Before signing a rental contract, ask about their average response time for technical issues. A good provider will have a service-level agreement (SLA) or a guarantee for repair turnaround.

3. Hidden Fees and Unexpected Charges

While printer rental is often cost-effective, some clients are caught off guard by hidden charges. These might include:

  • Additional fees for exceeding monthly print volume

  • Overcharges for toner replacements

  • Service fees not clearly outlined in the contract

To avoid this, always ask for a transparent cost breakdown. For a better idea of pricing, check out How Much Does Printer Rental Cost?

4. Incompatible Printer Models

Another common issue is receiving a printer that doesn’t meet your actual business needs. It could be too slow, lack wireless functionality, or not support your preferred paper size or print volume. This usually happens when rental agreements are made without a proper needs assessment.

Recommendation:
Work with a provider that evaluates your business workflow before recommending a printer. You can also explore your options here: What Types of Printers Can I Rent?

5. Insufficient Training for Staff

Some rental agreements don’t include staff onboarding or proper training on how to use the printer efficiently. This can lead to misuse, frequent errors, or even damage to the unit.

Solution:
Request a quick demo or user manual during the installation. Better yet, choose a rental provider that offers on-site training or remote assistance to walk your team through the machine's features.

6. Limited Customization or Upgrade Options

Over time, your printing needs may change. Perhaps you need faster printing, color output, or scanning features. Some rental contracts lock you into the same machine for the entire term with no upgrade flexibility.

Tip:
Ask your provider about upgrade options or early termination clauses. To better understand rental durations and flexibility, you can read How Long Can I Rent a Printer For?

7. Supplies Not Delivered on Time

A printer without toner or paper is useless. One frustration among businesses is when the rental provider fails to replenish supplies on time. This leads to unexpected delays and downtime.

Best practice:
Ensure your agreement includes automatic or scheduled supply delivery, especially for high-volume offices.

8. Security and Data Privacy Concerns

Many modern printers store digital information on their internal memory. If not properly managed, this could pose a risk to sensitive business data, especially in multi-user environments.

What to do:
Ask your provider how they handle data security, especially when printers are returned or replaced. They should offer a data wipe or secure return process.

9. Lack of Scalability

As your company grows, so do your printing needs. Some rental providers may not be able to scale with your operations—whether that means adding more units or providing enterprise-level support.

Look for:
A provider with a wide range of printer models and the capacity to support expansion, whether you're adding a single branch or scaling to nationwide operations.

Summary: Avoiding the Pitfalls of Printer Rentals

To summarize, what are the most common issues with rented printers? They include equipment malfunctions, poor support, hidden fees, mismatched models, lack of flexibility, and logistical issues. Fortunately, these can be prevented by partnering with a reliable rental provider that prioritizes customer service and transparency.

Here’s a quick checklist to help you avoid rental headaches:

✅ Choose a provider with responsive support and a clear SLA
✅ Read the fine print—know your costs and what's included
✅ Request a needs assessment before selecting a unit
✅ Ask about upgrade paths and contract flexibility
✅ Ensure data security and proper machine retirement procedures
✅ Verify how and when supplies will be delivered

If you're new to printer rentals or still exploring options, you might want to start with this guide: What Is Printer Rental?

Final Thoughts

Printer rental is a smart move for businesses looking for flexibility and cost-efficiency. But like any service, it’s important to know what you're getting into. By understanding what are the most common issues with rented printers, you can make informed choices, avoid pitfalls, and enjoy a hassle-free experience.

For more resources about printer rentals, visit Marga Enterprises and explore our helpful guides and solutions.
